definition:

bluish

discolored by or as if by bruising

a blue object

any of numerous small chiefly blue butterflies (family Lycaenidae)

bluefish

blue cheese

one of the three colors (see color entry 1 sense 15) that quarks have in the theory of quantum chromodynamics                                      
             
             One cannot have a single quark on its own because it would have a color (red, green, or blue). Instead, a red quark has to be joined to a green and a blue quark by a "string" of gluons (red + green + blue = white). Such a triplet constitutes a proton or a neutron.

without advance notice : unexpectedly                                      
             
             the job offer came out of the blue
to make (something) blue in color: such as

to dye, tint, or paint (something) blue                                      
             
             Last, the generation of the grandmothers, in immaculately blued hair …

to heat (iron or steel) to about 550 to 600 degrees Fahrenheit so that it acquires a protective bluish coating                                      
             
             the blued barrel of the gun

to turn blue                                      
             
             their blueing fingers

to curse angrily                                      
             
             He sliced the air with his fists and blued the air with his mouth.

sad or unhappy

One cannot have a single quark on its own because it would have a color (red, green, or blue). Instead, a red quark has to be joined to a green and a blue quark by a "string" of gluons (red + green + blue = white). Such a triplet constitutes a proton or a neutron.
the job offer came out of the blue
Last, the generation of the grandmothers, in immaculately blued hair …
the blued barrel of the gun
Between banks shrouded with snow, the river gleamed darkly, like blued steel with gold chips of sunlight dancing on each riffle.
He sliced the air with his fists and blued the air with his mouth.
I have been stealing my father's copy (of Massachusetts Wildlife) for a long time, but last week he found an issue on my desk and blued the air a bit.
shocked at the blue banter she heard on that satellite-radio talk show
a cold, dreary day always leaves me blue
a mixture of blues and greens
They sailed off into the blue.

definition: something that is blue is the same colour as the sky on a clear sunny day. If something is similar to this colour, you can say that it is a bluish colour
feeling rather sad
dealing with sex in a way that some people find offensive
in: He looked at her with his pale blue eyes.
blue with cold: My fingers were turning blue with cold.
She usually calls her mother when she’s feeling blue.
until/till you are blue in the face

definition: of the colour of the sky without clouds on a bright day, or a darker or lighter type of this:
showing or mentioning sexual activity in a way that offends many people:
feeling or showing sadness:
(of meat) cooked so that it is still very red
the colour of the sky without clouds on a bright day, or a darker or lighter type of this
a person who has played a sport for Oxford University against Cambridge University or for Cambridge University against Oxford University, or the title given to him or her for this
an argument with someone:
(of) the color of the sky on a clear, bright day:
sad; unhappy:
in: Her hands were blue with cold (= slightly blue because of the cold).
His humour is a bit too blue for my tastes.
He's been a bit blue since she left him.
He had a blue with his wife in the middle of the street.
I don’t know what’s wrong – I just feel blue.

Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
The person who who left you broken.
The first boy to make you fall in love. The first boy ever to make you cry. Those blue eyes that no little girl sees unless they do but if they do ....Whoever has those eyes; that's BLUE.

Very first love. The one who made you cry first. The one that had those magic blue eyes that are deep in color; that of different shades, dark to light. Unforgettable night waiting by phone, crying over each other. The connection to innocent when reference to that sincere puppy-dog look in the eyes. First emotions. Emotions your first boyfriend spoken as only you know it because it's your heart. It's deep. Deep blue. That first love. It seems everything to you. (That's my blue). In reference to a dream is as big as the sky; To think of the sky...no limits. eyes. Something in the blue is too bright, deep and definite to dismiss. Feels so true it makes everything surreal. Too good to be true?
Blue eyes that are so bright but that have to be on *that guy"; that's your " "Blue".
The hue of the portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in a human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers.
Of A Color Intermediate between Green and Violet.
